ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
The Causal Testing Framework is composed of a causal inference-driven architecture designed for functional black-box testing.
It leverages graphical causal inference (CI) techniques to specify and evaluate software behaviour from a black-box perspective.
Within this framework, causal directed acyclic graphs (DAGs) are used to represent the expected cause–effect relationships between
the inputs and outputs of the system under test, supported by mathematical foundations for designing statistical procedures that
enable causal inference. Each causal test case targets the causal effect of a specific intervention on the system under test--that is,
a deliberate modification to the input configuration expected to produce a corresponding change in one or more outputs.
about.summary: A causal inference-driven framework for functional black-box testing of complex software.

about.description:
The Causal Testing Framework is composed of a causal inference-driven architecture designed for functional black-box testing.
It leverages graphical causal inference (CI) techniques to specify and evaluate software behaviour from a black-box perspective.
Within this framework, causal directed acyclic graphs (DAGs) are used to represent the expected cause–effect relationships between
the inputs and outputs of the system under test, supported by mathematical foundations for designing statistical procedures that
enable causal inference. Each causal test case targets the causal effect of a specific intervention on the system under test--that is,
a deliberate modification to the input configuration expected to produce a corresponding change in one or more outputs.
about.summary: A causal inference-driven framework for functional black-box testing of complex software.

name: causal-testing-framework
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "causal-testing-framework" %}
{% set version = "14.0.0" %}
{% set python_min = "3.10" %}
{% set python_max = "3.13" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/causal_testing_framework-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e82aa6ff6710f8906e2a4f456e4d19a548fd519f6202f2195cc183a02374747e

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - setuptools >=64
    - setuptools-scm >=6.2
    - wheel
    - pip
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }},<={{ python_max }}
    - lifelines >=0.30.0,<0.31.dev0
    - networkx >=3.4,<3.5
    - numpy >=1.2.6,<=2.2.0
    - pandas >=2.1
    - scikit-learn >=1.4,<2.dev0
    - scipy >=1.12.0,<=1.16.2
    - statsmodels >=0.14,<1.dev0
    - tabulate >=0.9,<1.dev0
    - pydot >=2.0,<3.dev0
    - pygad >=3.3,<4.dev0
    - deap >=1.4.1,<1.5.dev0
    - sympy >=1.13.1,<1.14.dev0
    - pyarrow >=19.0.1,<19.1.dev0
    - fastparquet >=2024.11.0,<2024.12.dev0
    - tqdm >=4.67.1,<4.68.dev0

test:
  imports:
    - causal_testing
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/CITCOM-project/CausalTestingFramework
  summary: A causal inference-driven framework for functional black-box testing of complex software.
  description: |
    The Causal Testing Framework is composed of a causal inference-driven architecture designed for functional black-box testing. 
    It leverages graphical causal inference (CI) techniques to specify and evaluate software behaviour from a black-box perspective. 
    Within this framework, causal directed acyclic graphs (DAGs) are used to represent the expected cause–effect relationships between 
    the inputs and outputs of the system under test, supported by mathematical foundations for designing statistical procedures that 
    enable causal inference. Each causal test case targets the causal effect of a specific intervention on the system under test--that is, 
    a deliberate modification to the input configuration expected to produce a corresponding change in one or more outputs.
  doc_url: https://causal-testing-framework.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/CITCOM-project/CausalTestingFramework
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - f-allian
    - jmafoster1
